properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Cape Shoalwater WA to Cascade Head OR out 10 nm; Waters from Cape Shoalwater WA to Cascade Head OR from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 21 at 8:29AM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
The areas affected include...
Coastal waters from Cape Shoalwater WA to Cascade Head OR out 10
nm...
Waters from Cape Shoalwater WA to Cascade Head OR from 10 to 60
nm...

At 829 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated a large area of thunderstorms
offshore of the northwest Oregon Coast, capable of producing winds
to around 40 knots, half inch hail, and occasional cloud to water
lightning strikes. These thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 17 nm south of Columbia River Buoy 29 to 27 nm west
of Cape Meares to 30 nm west of Cape Lookout, moving northeast at 25
knots.

These thunderstorms will remain over mainly open waters.
properties.instruction:
Mariners can expect gusty winds to around 30 knots, locally higher
waves, and lightning strikes. Boaters should seek safe harbor
immediately until these storms pass.

NWSheadline: THUNDERSTORMS AFFECTING WATERS OFF THE NORTHWEST OREGON COAST
